### finalizeWithMemoryManagerLocking() {#a71b4a375f2964ea13d4064b81dba59ef}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::RuntimeDyld::finalizeWithMemoryManagerLocking ()">
Perform all actions needed to make the code owned by this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> instance executable:

1) Apply relocations. 2) <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> EH frames. 3) Update memory permissions&#42;.


<ul>
<li>Finalization is potentially recursive&#42;&#42;, and the 3rd step will only be applied by the outermost call to finalize. This allows different <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> instances to share a memory manager without the innermost finalization locking the memory and causing relocation fixup errors in outer instances.</li>
</ul>


&#42;&#42; Recursive finalization occurs when one <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> instances needs the address of a symbol owned by some other instance in order to apply relocations.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h/#l00284">284</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h">RuntimeDyld.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/runtimedyld-cpp/#l01426">1426</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/runtimedyld-cpp">RuntimeDyld.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</MemberDefinition>

### getSymbolLocalAddress() {#a386fd7c34168ea0124ab65e01987f84c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void &#42; llvm::RuntimeDyld::getSymbolLocalAddress (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Name) const</>}>
Get the address of our local copy of the symbol.

This may or may not be the address used for relocation (clients can copy the data around and resolve relocatons based on where they put it).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h/#l00204">204</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h">RuntimeDyld.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/runtimedyld-cpp/#l01388">1388</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/runtimedyld-cpp">RuntimeDyld.cpp</a>.

### getSymbolTable() {#a38e5c630fbb8b8fe89bfa069e408c0dd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::map&lt; StringRef, JITEvaluatedSymbol &gt; llvm::RuntimeDyld::getSymbolTable () const</>}>
Returns a copy of the symbol table.

This can be used by on-finalized callbacks to extract the symbol table before throwing away the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> instance. Because the map keys (StringRefs) are backed by strings inside the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> instance, the map should be processed before the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> instance is discarded.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h/#l00218">218</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h">RuntimeDyld.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/runtimedyld-cpp/#l01405">1405</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/runtimedyld-cpp">RuntimeDyld.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### mapSectionAddress() {#a0b3c521130df594d63177bda62de400d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::RuntimeDyld::mapSectionAddress (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> void &#42; LocalAddress, uint64&#95;t TargetAddress)</>}>
Map a section to its target address space value.

Map the address of a JIT section as returned from the memory manager to the address in the target process as the running code will see it. This is the address which will be used for relocation resolution.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h/#l00227">227</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h">RuntimeDyld.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/runtimedyld-cpp/#l01417">1417</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/runtimedyld-cpp">RuntimeDyld.cpp</a>.

### registerEHFrames() {#a90259a498cbb50bc825202e2a1ef6d3f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::RuntimeDyld::registerEHFrames ()">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> any EH frame sections that have been loaded but not previously registered with the memory manager.

Note, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> is responsible for identifying the EH frame and calling the memory manager with the EH frame section data. However, the memory manager itself will handle the actual target-specific EH frame registration.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h/#l00247">247</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h">RuntimeDyld.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/runtimedyld-cpp/#l01447">1447</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/runtimedyld-cpp">RuntimeDyld.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setNotifyStubEmitted() {#a78efb467e88df60120327e89b66f6b87}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::RuntimeDyld::setNotifyStubEmitted (<a href="#a7ca2c024ef2bb555f0d9c3aae8b40583">NotifyStubEmittedFunction</a> NotifyStubEmitted)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set the NotifyStubEmitted callback.

This is used for debugging purposes. A callback is made for each stub that is generated.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h/#l00238">238</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h">RuntimeDyld.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setProcessAllSections() {#a19cd93eb917e2a8cc5c900a5c0c015a4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::RuntimeDyld::setProcessAllSections (bool ProcessAllSections)"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
By default, only sections that are &quot;required for execution&quot; are passed to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/rtdyldmemorymanager">RTDyldMemoryManager</a>, and other sections are discarded.

Passing &#39;true&#39; to this method will cause <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> to pass all sections to its memory manager regardless of whether they are &quot;required to execute&quot; in the usual sense. This is useful for inspecting metadata sections that may not contain relocations, E.g. Debug info, stackmaps.

Must be called before the first object file is loaded.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h/#l00262">262</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/runtimedyld-h">RuntimeDyld.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
